limits: The blessing lasts until you finish a long rest or you use this feature again.

effects: You always have the spells in the Trickery Domain Spells table prepared at the cleric levels shown.
You expend one use of Channel Divinity to create a visual illusion of yourself in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet.
The illusion is intangible and doesn’t occupy its space; it lasts for 1 minute.
The illusion ends early if you have the Incapacitated condition.
While it persists, you can cast spells as though you were in the illusion’s space, but you must use your own senses.
While it persists, when both you and the illusion are within 5 feet of a creature that can see the illusion, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature.
While it persists, as a bonus action you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of yourself.
limits: The illusion ends early if you dismiss it (no action required).

feature_defs.trigger: when you take the bonus action to create or move your Invoke Duplicity illusion
effects: You can teleport, swapping places with the illusion.
Shared Distraction: when you and your allies attack a creature within 5 feet of the illusion, the attacks have advantage.
Healing Illusion: when the illusion ends, you or a creature of your choice within 5 feet of it regains hit points equal to your cleric level.
